H0.text: Star, galaxy, solar system, universe is the correct order for structures in space from smallest to largest.

H1.text: Star, solar system, galaxy, universe is the correct order of structures in space from smallest to largest.

H2.text: Star, solar system, universe, galaxy is a list of structures in space ordered from smallest to largest.

H3.text: Star, universe, solar system, galaxy is the correct list of structures in space from smallest to largest.

A4.text: The Solar System includes the Sun and all objects that are bound to it by gravity and orbit it.

A5.text: The Milky Way has a diameter of at least 26,800 parsecs (87,400 ly) and is separated from the Andromeda Galaxy, its nearest large neighbour, by just over 750,000 parsecs (2.5 million ly).

A6.text: The Herculesâ€“Corona Borealis Great Wall, currently the largest structure in the universe found so far, is 10 billion light-years (three gigaparsecs) in length.
